inclusion.criterion: History of localization-related epilepsy for two or more years
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Patients are on a stable anti-convulsant regimen defined as unchanged medicines and dose modifications lower than 20% in the last month.
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: Seizures are not completely responsive to medical treatment (1 or more seizures per week for at least 6 months) and patients have continued seizures despite best medical treatment in the past.
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: The patient first developed seizures at age 13 found by family to have a generalized convulsion. He had a second seizure two years after his first episode.

inclusion.criterion: The patients have a localized neocortical seizure focus, based on EEG and neuroimaging findings.
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Per outside medical patient was felt to have focal epilepsy with secondary generalization, likely due to anoxic brain injury at birth, and probably related to the atrophic changes seen on MRI, particularly in the left temporal lobe.

exclusion.criterion: Increased intracranial pressure as expressed by the presence of papilledema
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient has a history of severe intellectual disability, CHF, and epilepsy. He presented with facial twitching on the right and generalized shaking in at his NH which required 20 mg valium to cease seizure activity.
